DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate impact exercise intervention patient-reported anxiety , depression , fatigue , sleep disturbance among acute leukemia patient . The investigator hypothesize exercise reduce fatigue acute leukemia patient .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose randomize , prospective , longitudinal study evaluate impact exercise intervention patient-reported anxiety , depression , fatigue , sleep disturbance outcomes among acute leukemia patient . The study include 2 group total sample size 30 : n=15 control group n=15 intervention group . Each patient enrol intervention arm participate exercise program duration hospitalization , 4-6 week average first treatment ( induction chemotherapy ) .
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnose acute leukemia pathology report Admitted induction chemotherapy within previous 96 hour +/ 3 day initiation induction chemotherapy An expected hospital stay 34 week long Participation study must approve physician directly responsible patient 's care University North Carolina Hospitals Age > 21 year age Willing able provide , sign informed consent Willing able use computer complete study questionnaire Ability understand speak English The criterion determine patient 's physician review patient 's medical history . If exclusion criterion observe , patient inform excluded participating study . Participation study involve risk exercise regimen . Given potential risk involve , patient screen exclusion base upon follow criterion : Cardiovascular disease ( unless disease would compromise patient 's ability participate exercise rehabilitation program ) Acute chronic respiratory disease would compromise patient 's ability participate exercise rehabilitation program Acute chronic bone , joint , muscular abnormality would compromise patient 's ability participate exercise rehabilitation program Inability understand speak English Dementia , alter mental status , psychiatric condition would prohibit understanding rendering informed consent Another active malignancy Patients also exclude active bleeding , acute thrombosis , ischemia , hemodynamically unstable , uncontrolled pain .
